item.description:
Hi group,

John Puzzo is a guy who has served this country over and beyond the call of duty. He is a devoted and caring person who is going to be sharing his experinece at the Connecticut Historical Society on November 11th from 4 - 6:00 PM. I would like the NCC to show up in numbers to support him and honor him.

He has written several books on the Vietnam experience and they will be for sale at the presentation. Please consider purchasing them if you are able.

Here is a short bio on John from his blod entitled "The Roman":

http://www.blogger.co...

He more than deserves our attendance at this event.

In Patriotism,

Carole


DIRECTIONS:


One Elizabeth Street at Asylum Avenue
Hartford, CT 06105
Tel: (860) 236-5621
Fax: (860) 236-2664

Come down the Merritt Parkway to the I91 interchange. Head for the signs that take you to '691' East/West and head towards Waterbury. GO about 8 miles and take I84 EAST towards Hartford. It's a right hand exit - don't miss it or you will end up in Waterbury:

From Interstate Route 84, west of downtown Hartford, take exit 46 (Sisson Avenue). Turn right at the end of the ramp onto Sisson Avenue.
At the second traffic light turn left onto Farmington Avenue. Go one block and turn right onto Girard Avenue (at Arrow Pharmacy).
At the second intersection turn right onto Elizabeth Street. The Connecticut Historical Society, with ample free parking, is the second drive on the right.
item.name: Connecticut Historical Society Presentation by Our Group Member John Puzzo
